p: To assess the effect of the organophosphorus compound and essential-oils on oxidative stress situation, the some antioxidant biomarkers were evaluated in the different groups. Results showed that oxidative-stress induced by malathion-treatment is explained by a significant increase ( P < 0.05) of lipoperoxydation in testis and epididymis, hydrogen peroxide production ( P < 0.05) as well as a decrease ( P < 0.05) of thiol groups content (Tables 5, 6 and 7). However, the treatment of animals with LSEO protects against all these alterations caused by malathion-intoxication. On another hand, we examined the antioxidant-enzyme-activities in testis and epididymis (Tables 8, 9, 10 and 11). As expected, malathion-intoxication induced a significantly ( P < 0.05) reduce of CAT, GPx, total SOD and SOD isoforms such as Cu/Zn-SOD and Mn-SOD activities. The sub-chronic co-administration of LSEO markedly (P < 0.05) protected against the depletion of testis/epididymis antioxidant enzyme activities induced by malathion exposure during 30 days.
